Because of the way the zoning laws are written in Seattle, they only count a dwelling unit if it has a kitchen with a stove in it.
So one stove, one kitchen, that's a dwelling unit.

But developers have said well, if seven units and one kitchen is one unit, then 49 units and, you know, seven kitchens is seven units.
So they went to the city and got approval for developing a seven-unit apartment, or seven-unit townhouse.
